text: The Panoptikum Hamburg is a wax museum in Hamburg, Germany. Founded in 1879 by Friedrich Hermann Faerber, it is the country's oldest wax museum. Each wax figure takes up to two years and €40,000 to complete. According to its owners, the Panoptikum receives around 200,000 visitors annually as of 2018. ==References== Category:Wax museums Category:Museums in Hamburg Category:Museums established in 1879 Category:1879 establishments in Germany
title: Panoptikum Hamburg
